text: Hello everyone.
Today we shall talk about
how generative AI can help industries or enterprises
who process or handle
text data on a daily basis.
For reference, let us consider the Auto Insurance Industry.
Assume there is a customer ...
who met with a car accident
and wants to process the claim.
He submits the claim
to the insurance company.
Assume the customer has written a big, lengthy email
describing how the incident happened,
with all the important and vital information in that.
Once this email is sent to the auto insurance company,
this email would be assigned as a claim to
our insurance officer.
Once a claim is assigned to the insurance officer,
on eye level, these are some of the steps
that the insurance officer will follow to process the claim.
Step one...
You will read
through the content word
by word and comprehend without
losing any vital information.
Step two.
It will extract some of the information like car make and model,
policy number,
location, date, time, etc.
And in the final step
it will go through some of the relevant information
or existing documents or records
and it will come up with the
next best recommended steps.
Once those are generated,
you will send those steps back to the customer.
In this process, some of the challenges
that the Insurance Officer will go through are:
First,  it's time consuming.
Second, since it's manual effort,
there could be some errors. It's error prone.
And third,
in a day you can only process a limited number of claims per day.
This is where our insurance officer
can make use of our generative AI LLM models
to overcome some of these challenges.
Let us understand how.
Once the claim is assigned to our insurance officer,
he can send the claim to our LLM models
and our LLM model can create a summarized,
or condensed version of the claim.
This way the insurance officer
in less amount of time
without reading the complete text,
he can understand what's happening within the claim.
Second,
with less effort and an automated approach,
our LLM model can do entity extraction from the claim.
It can help the insurance officer
to extract policy number, date, time, location, etc.
in no time without much errors.
Third, our LLM models
can go through the existing documents and records,
grab the information,
and come up with the next best recommended steps.
This way, our insurance officer
can review some of the output generated by the LLM model
and can send the email back to the customer.
This is how the insurance officer can make use of LLM models
to consume less time, less error, or possibly no errors,
and be more proactive by processing more number of claims in a day.
If you liked this video and want to see more like it,
please like and subscribe.
If you have any questions
or want to share your thoughts about this topic,
please leave a comment below.
Thank you.
